availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert L. Crowell (Caldwell co., ky, farmer and pvt. 20th Ky Inf )

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. North Carolina native. Married to Mahulda "Hulda" Brantley Crowell in Crittenden County, Kentucky, on April 2, 1847. Father of Harriet J. Crowell, Sarah C. Crowell, Joseph Crowell, Sanders Crowell, Mary Crowell, and Pernecia Crowell. Resident in Crittenden County in 1850. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1860. Served in the 20th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from January 6, 1862, to January 17, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, District 1, p. 262B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Farmersville, p. 122.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Illinois, Jackson County, Murphysboro, p. 225A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Crittenden County Marriages, Film #000558428, p. 29-30.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 48.
